author: María Álvarez
text:
Hope is the thing with feathers 
That perches in the Soul— 
and sings the tune without the words
and never stops 
At all.

#EmilyDickinson
#Dickinson

author: María Álvarez
text:
Show me Eternity, and I will show you Memory — 
Both in one package lain
And lifted back again —
Be Sue, while I am Emily —
Be next, what you have ever been, Infinity —

#EmilyDickinson
#Dickinson

author: María Álvarez
text:
«To catch beauty would be to understand how that impertinent stability in vertigo is possible. But no, delight need not reach so far. To be running breathlessly, but not yet arrived, is itself delightful, a suspended moment of living hope.»

@carsonbot Eros the Bittersweet

author: María Álvarez
text:
when we who refuse to be women and men as women and men are chartered, tell our stories of solitude spent in multitude 

in that world as it may be, newborn and haunted, what will solitude mean?

Adrienne Rich

Verses from Yom Kippur 1984

Virginia Woolf

author: María Álvarez
text:
«We must always take sides. Neutrality helps the oppressor, never the victim. Silence encourages the tormentor, never the tormented.»

Elie Wiesel

author: María Álvarez
text:
Truthfulness anywhere means a heightened complexity. But it’s a movement into evolution.

Adrienne Rich

author: María Álvarez
text:
An honorable human relationship — that is, one in which two people have the right to use the word “love” — is a process, delicate, violent, often terrifying to both persons involved, a process of refining the truths they can tell each other.

Adrienne Rich
